info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 3:59PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Granite and southwestern Powell Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 358 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southwest of Drummond, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Drummond, Hall and Bearmouth. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 137 and 153. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for west central Montana.
